intro: Gymnadenia conopsea proles pseudoconopsea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 1 meter in height, adorned with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers in late summer, typically arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
